Comments_List: Basics and ideas of machine learning. Language R.
I learned about classification and prediction problems with machine learning.
Increased skill in computational programming.
I learned lots of methods of machine learning as well as their principles.
introduction to machine learning

I learnt some very important machine learning concepts like classification algorithms, the bias-variance trade off and some advanced concepts like topic modeling and sparse coding. Overall, very useful course for my research.
So incredibly much
R programming, basic machine learning knowledge
The was by far my most fun course.  Though challenging, we learned a wide variety of material on how to process and use data to make predictions/make models.
I learnt how to use basic machine learning concepts in a very applied way through coding assignments. The assignments were challenging & unique. The assignments really made me learn the material.
Machine learning, statistics, and R.
Machine learning skills
Coding, comprehensive acknowledgement of machine learning
Many Machine Learning Techniques. This was an amazing useful course.
I learnt a lot of skills and knowledge about machine learning and data mining by taking this course.
I learn a lot of important machine learning methods.
I've improved my Machine Learning skills and knowledge and R coding a lot
The choice of materials is good, and is rigorous. It would be better if more examples, and sample solutions are provided.

The course is outstanding. The lectures truly do a great job of balancing accessibility and rigor. The downside is that the expectation of doing the math on the assignments feels a little disconnected from the instruction (though the connections are clearly there for us to make). I think Prof. Lafferty should keep teaching it exactly as he does, but the course would benefit from a weekly section that focused on math and coding.
Concepts taught in lecture did not reflect expectations on assignments.

Strengths: Covers lots of ground. Interesting homework.

Cons: Homework planning and logistics needs work. I usually start assignments very early. In this course, I generally left it until the last day or two, because when I worked on it early, I'd check PIazza and find out there were different corrections to the problems, or explanations of the best way to do it, or clarifications on what they asked for. So it felt like it was most efficient to wait until near the end fo do the assignment, because when it was first posted they were still figuring it out.

Strengths:
- prof. is very knowledgeable about topic
- good support from TAs
- assignments are well-designed and cover a good breadth of material

Weaknesses:
- course moved slowly and covered many topics superficially because there were too many unprepared students in the course
- no discussion of ethics

Improvements:
- Restrict enrollment on the basis of stats/math prerequisites
- Greater focus on theoretical underpinnings in coursework and lecture
- Group discussion/critical thinking. It's a little shocking to me that so many people are getting an introduction to this topic without being told how badly data science can be and is being misused.
The course is very well organized and covers many fields of machine learning.

Strength- Awesome professor ( totally mind-blowing), responsive TAs ( replied to every question in less than a day), good coverage of topics

Improvement- For graduate students, may be replace the final exam with a final project so that we can get some early feedback from Professor about our machine-learning related research ideas

Strengths:Explain machine learning in an understandable way.
Weaknesses: Too few mathematics and statistics

As stated about, this was easily my most fun course this semester.  The instructor did a fabulous job with making the material (both in class and on the assignments) relatable and engaging.

My only issue is that the doing of the PSets very strongly relied on one's mastery of RStudio.  While none of the actual concepts in the course were terribly difficult, it would take me hours to get the programming correct.  In effect, this was as much an "RStudio" class as a Machine Learning class.  

Nevertheless, I thoroughly enjoyed it!

Strengths - Assignment based evaluation; Unique nature of assignments; Not returning solutions as they get passed on to next year; faculty's expertise and in-depth understanding; applied nature of the course (rather than theoretical)
Weaknesses - None
excellent course
SVM is not covered in the class,LDA and NLP are too hard for an introductory level class. Otherwise, it is very good for one who wants to learn about machine learning.
I think the course should have more theoretical exercise. It seems that the assignments focus too much on applications.
Yes. Very useful and definitely accessible.
Highly recommend. There's no way you have a better option for learning this material.
Yes, if they have some basic programming background.
I would recommend this class to a student only if significant steps were taken to limit enrollment on the basis of prerequisites. I think it was taught well considering that the course is new.
Yes. The knowledge I learned from the course is very useful in my daily research.
It is a good course to explore the area of machine learning.
Yes , would strongly recommend!
Absolutely
Yes
Yes, the material in this course is invaluable.  However, I would make sure they had a good understanding of how to use RStudio.
Yes, since machine learning is becoming a very important method across domains, this is a must for any student interested in research or cutting edge work in industry.
I will, because it is very helpful.
Yes! Professor Lafferty is great!
Absolutely
Yes. Definitely.
Yes, highly recommend.

Definitely.
